
{{alias}}( v1, v2 )
    Tests if two arguments are both single-precision complex floating-point
    numbers and have the same value.

    The function differs from the `===` operator in that the function treats
    `-0` and `+0` as distinct and `NaNs` as the same.

    Parameters
    ----------
    v1: any
        First input value.

    v2: any
        Second input value.

    Returns
    -------
    bool: boolean
        Boolean indicating whether two arguments are the same.

    Examples
    --------
    > var x = new {{alias:@stdlib/complex/float32}}( 1.0, 2.0 );
    > var y = new {{alias:@stdlib/complex/float32}}( 1.0, 2.0 );
    > var bool = {{alias}}( x, y )
    true

    > x = new {{alias:@stdlib/complex/float32}}( NaN, NaN );
    > y = new {{alias:@stdlib/complex/float32}}( NaN, NaN );
    > bool = {{alias}}( x, y )
    true

    See Also
    --------
